Dituding Telat Serahkan Draf Anggaran, DKI: Sudah Sejak Juli
07 Nov 2019, 06:12 by Taufiq Siddiq, Ninis Chairunnisa
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta membantah terlambat menyerahkan berkas rancangan Kebijakan Umum Anggaran-Prioritas Plafon Anggaran Sementara atau KUA PPAS 2020 kepada DPRD DKI.
"Siapa yang bilang kita berika last minute?." kata Sekretaris Daerah DKI Jakarta Saefullah saat ditemui di Balai Kota DKI, Rabu 7 November 2019.
Saefullah menyatakan telah memberikan berkas KUA PPAS pada 5 Juli lalu ke DPRD. Ia juga menyebut saat itu ada bukti serah terima draft tersebut.
Selain itu, kata Saefullah, DKI kemudian bersurat kepada DPRD pada Oktober lalu untuk mulai membahas KUA PPAS. Karena saat itu kata dia, DPRD belum juga memulai pembahasan.
Saefullah menyatakan telah mengikuti alur rancangan APBD sesuai regulasi yang telah ditetapkan Kementerian Dalam Negeri. Dia pun heran jika DKI dituding telat memberikan rancangan anggaran.
Menurut Saefullah, sampai saat ini rancangan KUA PPAS 2020 masih belum kelar karena pembahasan di DPRD. Salah satunya akibat pergantian anggota DPRD baru pada Agustus lalu. "Salah satunya karena ada pergantian dewan," kata dia mengungkapkan alasan lamanya pembahasan rancangan APBD 2020.
Sekretaris Jenderal Seknas Forum Indonesia Untuk Transparansi Anggaran (Fitra) Misbah Hasan sebelumnya mengatakan Pemprov DKI Jakarta terlambat melimpahkan dokumen KUA PPAS ke DPRD DKI Jakarta. Dokumen yang seharusnya sudah selesai pada Juli-Agustus lalu, baru diserahkan pada awal bulan ini.
Hal itu membuat anggota dewan tak memiliki waktu cukup untuk menyisir anggaran belanja yang ganjil. "Kalau sekarang, anggota dewan jadi enggak punya waktu untuk 'metani' atau menyisir anggaran yang dianggap janggal Padahal ini kan tugas wakil rakyat," ujar Misbah dalam jumpa pers di Populi Center, Jakarta Barat, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Hal senada juga disampaika Wakil Ketua DPRD DKI Zita Anjani. Ia mengatakan fungsi pengawasan legislator Kebon Sirih tidak bisa maksimal lantaran rendahnya transparansi anggaran yang diajukan untuk dibahas tahun depan. "Fungsi pengawasan kami tidak bisa maksimal, masa baru dikasih bahan anggaran yang nilainya miliaran satu menit sebelum rapat," kata dia.

Accused of Late Submitting Budget Draft, DKI: Since July
07 Nov 2019, 06:12 by Taufiq Siddiq, Ninis Chairunnisa
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta has denied it is too late to submit the draft of the General Policy Budget-Priority Budget Ceiling or KUA PPAS 2020 to the DPRD DKI.
"Who said we gave last minute?" said DKI Jakarta Regional Secretary Saefullah when met at the DKI City Hall, Wednesday 7 November 2019.
Saefullah claimed to have submitted the KUA PPAS file last July 5 to the DPRD. He also mentioned at the time there was evidence of the handover of the draft.
In addition, Saefullah said, DKI then wrote to the DPRD in October to begin discussing KUA PPAS. Because at that time he said, the DPRD had not yet begun discussion.
Saefullah said that he had followed the flow of the APBD draft in accordance with regulations set by the Ministry of the Interior. He was also surprised if DKI was accused of being late in providing a draft budget.
According to Saefullah, up to now the KUA PPAS 2020 draft has not been finished yet because of discussions in the DPRD. One of them is due to the replacement of new DPRD members last August. "One of them is because there is a change of council," he said, expressing the reason for the long discussion of the 2020 APBD draft.
Secretary General of the Indonesian Forum National Secretariat for Budget Transparency (Fitra) Misbah Hasan previously said that the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government was late in submitting KUA PPAS documents to the DKI Jakarta DPRD. The document, which should have been completed in July-August, was only submitted earlier this month.
That makes the board members do not have enough time to comb through the odd budget. "At present, the members of the council do not have time to 'metani' or comb through the budget that is considered odd. This is the task of the people's representatives," Misbah said at a press conference at Populi Center, West Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
A similar sentiment was also expressed by DKI Jakarta DPRD Deputy Chairman Zita Anjani. He said the oversight function of the legislator Kebon Sirih could not be maximized due to the low budget transparency proposed to be discussed next year. "Our oversight function cannot be maximized, a new period of budget material is given which is worth billions one minute before the meeting," he said.
